page.title: 11FARMING,THE CNEWR COMPANY
page.content: At some time between 1853 and 1859, Joseph Claypon granted a lease on the farm land to Robert McTurk (1833-1916) who farmed it until his death as the CNEWR COMPANY. In the 1860's he bought other hill land and in 1891 the original Crown Allotment was also conveyed to him. This increased the total area of the farm to about 12,000 acres (4,800 hectares). The estate has remained within the same family since that time.Although it seems that Cheviot sheep had already been introd- uced by Christie, local tradition has been that McTurk brought the first of the Cheviot breed to the area. Certainly he added considerably to their numbers. At that time he had to drive the flock all the way through the Welsh borderland from Crewe, in Cheshire, which in the 1850's was the nearest point on the railway to Cnewr.
